instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates special chaotic and stochastic oscillators
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

instr 1
    ; planet opcode: ax, ay planet kmass1, kmass2, ksep, ix, iy, ivx, ivy, idelta [, ifriction] [, iskip]
    ; planet simulates planetary motion (chaotic oscillator)
    ; kmass1, kmass2 - masses
    ; ksep - separation
    ; ix, iy - initial position
    ; ivx, ivy - initial velocity
    ; idelta - time step
    
    kMass1 = 1
    kMass2 = 1
    kSep = 0.5
    iX = 0
    iY = 0.5
    iVX = 0.5
    iVY = 0
    iDelta = 0.01
    
    aX, aY planet kMass1, kMass2, kSep, iX, iY, iVX, iVY, iDelta
    
    ; Use position as audio
    outs aX*0.3, aY*0.3
endin

instr 2
    ; lorenz opcode: ax, ay, az lorenz ks, kr, kb, kh, ix, iy, iz, iskip [, iskip]
    ; lorenz generates Lorenz attractor (chaotic system)
    ; ks, kr, kb - Lorenz parameters (sigma, rho, beta)
    ; kh - time step
    ; ix, iy, iz - initial conditions
    
    kS = 10
    kR = 28
    kB = 2.667
    kH = 0.01
    iX = 0.1
    iY = 0
    iZ = 0
    
    aX, aY, aZ lorenz kS, kR, kB, kH, iX, iY, iZ
    
    ; Scale and use as audio
    outs aX*0.02, aY*0.02
endin

instr 3
    ; gendy opcode: ares gendy kamp, kampdist, kdurdist, kadpar, kddpar, kminfreq, kmaxfreq, kampscl, kdurscl [, init] [, knum]
    ; gendy implements Xenakis' dynamic stochastic synthesis
    ; kamp - amplitude
    ; kampdist - amplitude distribution (0-6)
    ; kdurdist - duration distribution (0-6)
    ; kadpar - amplitude parameter
    ; kddpar - duration parameter
    ; kminfreq, kmaxfreq - frequency range
    ; kampscl, kdurscl - amplitude/duration scale
    
    kAmp = 0.4
    kAmpDist = 1  ; Linear
    kDurDist = 1  ; Linear
    kAdPar = 0.5
    kDdPar = 0.5
    kMinFreq = 220
    kMaxFreq = 880
    kAmpScl = 0.5
    kDurScl = 0.5
    
    aGendy gendy kAmp, kAmpDist, kDurDist, kAdPar, kDdPar, kMinFreq, kMaxFreq, kAmpScl, kDurScl
    
    outs aGendy, aGendy
endin

instr 4
    ; gendyc opcode: ares gendyc kamp, kampdist, kdurdist, kadpar, kddpar, kminfreq, kmaxfreq, kampscl, kdurscl, knum [, init]
    ; gendyc is controlled version of gendy
    ; knum - number of control points
    
    kAmp = 0.4
    kAmpDist = 1
    kDurDist = 1
    kAdPar = 0.3
    kDdPar = 0.7
    kMinFreq = 330
    kMaxFreq = 660
    kAmpScl = 0.4
    kDurScl = 0.6
    kNum = 12
    
    aGendyc gendyc kAmp, kAmpDist, kDurDist, kAdPar, kDdPar, kMinFreq, kMaxFreq, kAmpScl, kDurScl, kNum
    
    outs aGendyc, aGendyc
endin

instr 5
    ; gendyx opcode: ares gendyx kamp, kampdist, kdurdist, kadpar, kddpar, kminfreq, kmaxfreq, kampscl, kdurscl, knum, iwform [, init] [, iskip]
    ; gendyx extends gendy with custom waveforms
    ; iwform - waveform table
    
    kAmp = 0.4
    kAmpDist = 2  ; Cauchy
    kDurDist = 2
    kAdPar = 0.5
    kDdPar = 0.5
    kMinFreq = 200
    kMaxFreq = 800
    kAmpScl = 0.5
    kDurScl = 0.5
    kNum = 10
    iWform = 1  ; Use sine wave table
    
    aGendyx gendyx kAmp, kAmpDist, kDurDist, kAdPar, kDdPar, kMinFreq, kMaxFreq, kAmpScl, kDurScl, kNum, iWform
    
    outs aGendyx, aGendyx
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

f1 0 16384 10 1

; Play planet motion
i1 0 5

; Play Lorenz attractor
i2 6 5

; Play gendy
i3 12 5

; Play gendyc
i4 18 5

; Play gendyx
i5 24 5

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>
